properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 3:04PM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow On The Way Wednesday Into Thursday...

.A storm system moving north out of the lower Mississippi River
Valley and up across the Ohio River Valley will bring accumulating
snow of 2 to 4 inches to portions of the area Wednesday afternoon
through Thursday morning. The higher snow amounts are expected
east of the Mississippi River. This snow will be an impact on both
the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and north
central, northwest and west central Illinois. The higher snow
amounts are expected east of the Mississippi River.

* WHEN...From noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. A period or two of
moderate snowfall may reduce visibilities to less than one mile
at times. The hazardous conditions could impact both the
morning and evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

In Illinois, go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road
conditions.
In Iowa, call 511 for road conditions.
In Missouri, call 800-222-6400 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
